WorkItem.Description:
When replacing the default style for the datagrid, an 'object reference not set to an instance of an object' exception is thrown when a column is sorted and a new item is added.
the attached repro shows the behaviour,
Â 
In the DataGridStyle.xaml file is an exact copy of the generic.xaml file from the WPFToolkit.dll for the datagrid (with some internal classes commented out), to reproduce the bug, in the window1.xaml file, uncomment the lines in the Window.Resources tag, start the application, sort the Id column, add a new row with an id less than nine so it will be sorted somewhere in the middle of the list, an exception is thrown, with the reference to the resource dictionary commented out, no exception is thrown.
WorkItem.Summary: Sorting bug when replacing the default style for the datagrid

Comments.Message: We agree this is a bug. We've filed a bug in our internal database, and it will be fixed in a future release.
